p: Considering ethylic alcohol as a standard antimicrobial, we observed that micellar solutions, especially oregano oil present up to 64 times lower MICs/MBCs on Gram-positive cocci and on enteric Gram-negative rods. Thyme micellar oil was also found to be 2â€“4 times more potent than ethylic alcohol. Aqueous solutions were less effective than ethanol on all bacteria ( Table 3).
